title: Classic Tuna Noodle Casserole Recipe
description: This classic tuna noodle casserole features tender pasta, peas, and pimentos in a creamy condensed soup sauce with a buttery bread crumb topping.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Dinner Classic Tuna Noodle Casserole 4.3 (165) 119 Reviews 41 Photos This classic tuna noodle casserole is tossed with pasta, peas, and pimentos in a creamy sauce, then baked until bubbling with a crunchy crumb topping. Serve with your favorite frozen vegetable combination, followed by ice cream for dessert. Submitted by Campbell's Kitchen Updated on November 19, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 41 41 41 41 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 1 (1 1/2-quart) dish Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 cups hot cooked medium egg noodles 2 (6 ounce) cans tuna, drained and flaked 1 (10.5 ounce) can Campbell's Condensed Cream of Celery Soup or Campbell's Condensed 98% Fat-Free Cream of Celery Soup 1 cup cooked peas ½ cup milk 2 tablespoons chopped pimentos (Optional) 2 tablespoons dry bread crumbs 1 tablespoon butter, melted Directions Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Mix together noodles, tuna, condensed soup, peas, milk, and pimentos in a 1 1/2-quart baking dish until well combined. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, mix together bread crumbs and melted butter in a small bowl until combined. Sprinkle bread crumb mixture over the top of casserole. Continue baking until topping is golden brown, about 5 more minutes. Recipe Tip You can substitute cream of mushroom soup for the cream of celery. I Made It Print 355 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 362 Calories 9g Fat 36g Carbs 33g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 362 % Daily Value * Total Fat 9g 12% Saturated Fat 4g 18% Cholesterol 81mg 27% Sodium 497mg 22% Total Carbohydrate 36g 13% Dietary Fiber 4g 13% Total Sugars 5g Protein 33g 66% Vitamin C 6mg 7% Calcium 91mg 7% Iron 3mg 17% Potassium 710mg 15% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. name: Campbell's Kitchen
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C).;Mix together noodles, tuna, condensed soup, peas, milk, and pimentos in a 1 1/2-quart baking dish until well combined.;Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.;Meanwhile, mix together bread crumbs and melted butter in a small bowl until combined.;Sprinkle bread crumb mixture over the top of casserole. Continue baking until topping is golden brown, about 5 more minutes.
